headline: Ford zaps F-150 Lightning EV in pivot to hybrid vehicles
summary: While Ford (F) expects to take up to $19.5 billion in charges over its pivot to hybrid and extended range EVs (EREV) from full electric vehicles, the automaker is also going all in on gas-powered trucks and cancelling the current generation of the F-150 Lightning EVs. Yahoo Finance senior autos reporter Pras Subramanian comes on Market Domination Overtime to further discuss this news. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

Those storage systems, which will use cheaper LFP batteries, will be […]

headline: Ford scraps fully-electric F-150 Lightning as mounting losses and falling demand hits EV plans
summary: Ford Motor Co. is pivoting away from its once-ambitious electric vehicle plans amid financial losses and waning consumer demand for the vehicles in lieu of investment in more efficient gasoline-engines and hybrid EVs, the company said Monday.  The Detroit automaker, which has poured billions of dollars into electrification along with most of its industry peers, said it will no longer make the F-150 Lightning electric pickup truck, instead opting for an extended range version of the vehicle.  Ford will also introduce some manufacturing changes; its Tennessee Electric Vehicle Center — part of the BlueOval City campus and once the future of Ford's EVs and batteries — is being renamed the Tennessee Truck Plant and will produce new affordable gas-powered trucks instead.

content.title: Ford scraps fully-electric F-150 Lightning as mounting losses and falling demand hits EV plans
content.summary: Ford Motor Co. is pivoting away from its once-ambitious electric vehicle plans amid financial losses and waning consumer demand for the vehicles in lieu of investment in more efficient gasoline-engines and hybrid EVs, the company said Monday.  The Detroit automaker, which has poured billions of dollars into electrification along with most of its industry peers, said it will no longer make the F-150 Lightning electric pickup truck, instead opting for an extended range version of the vehicle.  Ford will also introduce some manufacturing changes; its Tennessee Electric Vehicle Center — part of the BlueOval City campus and once the future of Ford's EVs and batteries — is being renamed the Tennessee Truck Plant and will produce new affordable gas-powered trucks instead.

thumbnail.caption: FIEL - The company logo is shown on the grille of an unsold 2026 F-series pickup truck on the lot of a Ford dealership, Sunday, Nov. 2, 2025, in Littleton, Colo. (AP Photo/David Zalubowski, File)

headline: Ford stock rises as company raises 2025 guidance, shifts EV strategy
summary: Investing.com -- Ford Motor Company (NYSE:F) stock rose 2% in post-market trading after the automaker raised its 2025 adjusted EBIT guidance to about $7 billion from a previous forecast of $6 billion to $6.5 billion, citing continued underlying business strength and cost improvements.

content.title: Ford stock rises as company raises 2025 guidance, shifts EV strategy
content.summary: Investing.com -- Ford Motor Company (NYSE:F) stock rose 2% in post-market trading after the automaker raised its 2025 adjusted EBIT guidance to about $7 billion from a previous forecast of $6 billion to $6.5 billion, citing continued underlying business strength and cost improvements.

headline: Ford takes $19.5 billion hit as it pulls back on electric vehicle plans, halts F-150 Lightning production
summary: Ford on Monday said it is pulling back on its electric vehicle plans, a move that will result in a $19.5 billion charge against its earnings to be taken mostly in the current quarter.

content.summary: Ford on Monday said it is pulling back on its electric vehicle plans, a move that will result in a $19.5 billion charge against its earnings to be taken mostly in the current quarter.

thumbnail.caption: Ford's electric F-150 Lightning on the production line in Dearborn, Michigan, in September. The company announced it is halting production of this version of the Lightning, without saying when it will restart production of the electric pick-up. - Jeff Kowalsky/AFP/Getty Images
